source_id: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_028_chunk2
evidence_span: The deformation behavior of the irradiated Zr-2.5Nb is strongly dependent on its treatment in the final stages of fabrication. Provided the alloy is not taken above the β-transus since the last major deformation, then it has a combination of high strength, high uniform elongation, and generally good reduction in area at fracture (compared to Zircaloy)
